intro: Manihot tripartita var. subintegra, commonly known as the arrowleaf cupuaçu, is a tropical plant native to the Amazon basin. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and produces edible fruits that are rich in nutrients. The plant thrives in humid, tropical climates with well-drained soil. Its botanical significance lies in its potential as a source of natural ingredients for food and cosmetics. The species is also valued for its role in traditional medicine and sustainable agriculture.
